posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.48 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Link previews are now supported for URLs that point directly to an image file.

Also lots of work in prep for the Signal Backups Alpha.

Complete list of new commits since 7.47.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.47.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.47 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.48.0 (156000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

23 new commits since 7.47.2:

Show commits

  • Hide paragraph if not during manual restore. [1]

  • Only display failure sheet if there is actually a failure reported. [2]

  • Ensure proper thread snippet restore. [3]

  • Rotate libsignal-net remote config. [4]

  • Improve backup key password manager save error handling. [5]

    • Add "go to settings" button to missing credential manager error dialog.
    • Add handling for disabled password manager save prompt on Android API <= 33.

  • Flow beta tag to next row if there isn't enough room. [6]

  • Hide optimize storage if billing not available. [7]

  • Revert "Rotate libsignal-net remote config." [8]

  • Prevent system from displaying -1 other groups in common when there is 0 group in common. [9]

  • Add link preview support for raw images. [10]

  • Fix androidTest issue with deviceId generation. [11]

  • Replace MissingAddressError with more specific variants. [12]

  • Use RemoteConfig for UsePqRatchet. [13]

  • Attempt to resend pending messages if job creation failed. [14]

  • Fix lint. [15]

  • Clean up additional data when viewing view-once messages. [16]

  • Bump libsignal to v0.76.3. [17]

  • Rotate libsignal-net remote config flag name in anticipation of scale up. [18]

  • Restore timestamp instead of tier during manual registration remote backup restore flow. [19]

  • Fix db test leak warning. [20]

  • Fix wrapping long buttons on registrationv3 screens. [21]

  • Update translations and other static files. [22]

  • Bump version to 7.48.0 [23]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.47.2…v7.48.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Couldn’t transfer my history to iPad:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.48.0/fac6050ee3bdf830971a874b9073ebcc0788a69236e0c59a95be103e74b86898

Desktop works

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

Couldn’t transfer my history to iPad:

Weird, I see one successful link in your log, and that’s it. Are you on the latest version of Signal on iOS? What error do you see?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Just the failed history transfer prompt. Android seems to act correctly though as if nothing happened. Will try again on the latest TestFlight :)

On iPad I get: Error transferring your messages.
Now on the latest TestFlight. I posted some logs over there as well :)

Android doesn’t throw an error and everything looks fine there

Edit adding logs from the latest test: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.48.0/f1e55870accb3dabb1e422c1a388d130af3aebef70234dfd7b2275ed33ac2b8b

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Not sure how exactly but my read receipts were turned off without any interaction from my behalf.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.48.0/2a675bbf85607a90b8af51368cd4867aa254f655fe3a97553914cf6cff2ba063

Unread messages counter remained at 8 even though Ive already read all messages. It fixed itself just after I uploaded debug logs.

signal-2025-07-07-1826251051×875 27.4 KB

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.48.0/5168353b3c9b71282b728028090cd49874d30298ae873c6fa258c59aed113e1b

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
Whatnoww:

Just the failed history transfer prompt.

Tracking!

Whatnoww:

Not sure how exactly but my read receipts were turned off without any interaction from my behalf.

tracking!

DirkPitt1:

Unread messages counter remained at 8 even though Ive already read all messages. It fixed itself just after I uploaded debug logs.

Tracking!

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked: Did this happen randomly or after a reinstall? Did you change any account settings on another device?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Nope, I only linked it on my iPad.

Impossible to post story on 7.47 it stays on sending mode without being actually updated. It was also the case on 7.46.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.47.2/33d06ea0ba4dfb988e1645eaf04880c8fcc8043b9522af7f81ff0b2978368aab

link_counts.title: Signal keeps closing after I tried to post a story!

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
braz29:

Impossible to post story on 7.47 it stays on sending mode without being actually updated. It was also the case on 7.46.

Could you check the “info” for the story (open the story and press “more” action item and select info) to see whether it sent to anyone or to no one?

Whatnoww:

Nope, I only linked it on my iPad.

Thanks!

It says

"Send 10:24
Received 10:24
File size …

Waiting
[all contact names]"

My contacts haven’t seen anything

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

3 new commits since 7.48.0:

  • Update translations and other static files. [2]

  • Bump version to 7.48.1 [3]

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.49 release.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.49 release
